clinical_study.brief_title: Research and Characterization of New Genes Involved in Intellectual Disability
clinical_study.official_title: Recherche et caractérisation de Nouveaux gènes impliqués Dans la déficience Intellectuelle.

lead_sponsor.agency: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France

clinical_study.source: Institut National de la Santé Et de la Recherche Médicale, France

brief_summary.textblock:
Intellectual disability (ID) occurs in 2 to 3 % of the general population but the cause is identified only in 30 to 60% of cases.
The purpose of this study is to indentify genes involved in ID with new genetics tools (SNP-arrays, next generation sequencing...) and establish genotype-phenotype correlations.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with genetic cause identified
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants for which the causative gene of intellectual disability will be identified and number of genes involved in intellectual disability identified with new technologies including microarray and next generation sequencing

secondary_outcome.time_frame: genotype-phenotype correlations (according to the genes identified in a period of 5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Explore genotype-phenotype correlations when a new gene involved in intellectual disability will be identified

arm_group.description: patients with intellectual disability or psycho-motor retardation and their parents and sibs (affected or not)

study_pop.textblock:
- 2500 patients with intellectuel disability
- 5000 parents or unaffected sibs
- 1000 affected sibs

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- for the patients: Clinical diagnosis of intellectual disbility
- for the unaffected sibs: to be aged at least 3 years
- informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- absence of informed consent
